How can I add or remove an IP/Subnet from the banned list using the `setban` command?

You can add or remove an IP/Subnet from the banned list using the `setban` command with the following syntax:

`setban "ip(/netmask)" "add|remove" (bantime) (absolute)`

Where:

* `"ip(/netmask)"` is the IP/Subnet with an optional netmask (default is /32 = single IP)
* `"add"` or `"remove"` specifies whether to add or remove the IP/Subnet from the list
* `(bantime)` is the time in seconds for how long the IP is banned (0 or empty means using the default time of 24h)
* `(absolute)` is a boolean specifying whether the bantime is an absolute timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

setban "ip(/netmask)" "add|remove" (bantime) (absolute) Attempts add or remove a IP/Subnet from the banned list. Arguments: 1. "ip(/netmask)" (string, required) The IP/Subnet (see getpeerinfo for nodes ip) with a optional netmask (default is /32 = single ip) 2. "command"   (string, required) 'add' to add a IP/Subnet to the list, 'remove' to remove a IP/Subnet from the list 3. "bantime"   (numeric, optional) time in seconds how long (or until when if [absolute] is set) the ip is banned (0 or empty means using the default time of 24h which can also be overwritten by the -bantime startup argument) 4. "absolute"   (boolean, optional) If set, the bantime must be a absolute timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) Examples: > verus setban "192.168.0.6" "add" 86400 > verus setban "192.168.0.0/24" "add" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setban", "params": ["192.168.0.6", "add" 86400] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/setban
What is the default bantime if I don't specify it when using the `setban` command?
If you don't specify the bantime when using the `setban` command, the default bantime is 24 hours.

setban "ip(/netmask)" "add|remove" (bantime) (absolute) Attempts add or remove a IP/Subnet from the banned list. Arguments: 1. "ip(/netmask)" (string, required) The IP/Subnet (see getpeerinfo for nodes ip) with a optional netmask (default is /32 = single ip) 2. "command"   (string, required) 'add' to add a IP/Subnet to the list, 'remove' to remove a IP/Subnet from the list 3. "bantime"   (numeric, optional) time in seconds how long (or until when if [absolute] is set) the ip is banned (0 or empty means using the default time of 24h which can also be overwritten by the -bantime startup argument) 4. "absolute"   (boolean, optional) If set, the bantime must be a absolute timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) Examples: > verus setban "192.168.0.6" "add" 86400 > verus setban "192.168.0.0/24" "add" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setban", "params": ["192.168.0.6", "add" 86400] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How can I specify an absolute timestamp for the bantime when using the `setban` command?
You can specify an absolute timestamp for the bantime by setting the `(absolute)` parameter to `true` and providing the bantime as a timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT).

setban "ip(/netmask)" "add|remove" (bantime) (absolute) Attempts add or remove a IP/Subnet from the banned list. Arguments: 1. "ip(/netmask)" (string, required) The IP/Subnet (see getpeerinfo for nodes ip) with a optional netmask (default is /32 = single ip) 2. "command"   (string, required) 'add' to add a IP/Subnet to the list, 'remove' to remove a IP/Subnet from the list 3. "bantime"   (numeric, optional) time in seconds how long (or until when if [absolute] is set) the ip is banned (0 or empty means using the default time of 24h which can also be overwritten by the -bantime startup argument) 4. "absolute"   (boolean, optional) If set, the bantime must be a absolute timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) Examples: > verus setban "192.168.0.6" "add" 86400 > verus setban "192.168.0.0/24" "add" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setban", "params": ["192.168.0.6", "add" 86400] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

Can I use the `setban` command through a JSON-RPC request?

Yes, you can use the `setban` command through a JSON-RPC request. The JSON-RPC request should contain the `setban` method and the required parameters. For example:

`curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setban", "params": ["192.168.0.6", "add", 86400] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`

This will add the IP `192.168.0.6` to the banned list for 86400 seconds (24 hours).
